Australia: The transportation of convicts to Norfolk Island ceased.
All men over 21 years of age obtained the right to vote in South Australia.
Belgium: Pierre de Decker replaces Henri de Brouckère as Prime Minister
China: Third plague pandemic: A plague pandemic began in Yunnan which would kill hundreds of thousands in China and millions worldwide.
Punti-Hakka Clan Wars: An ethnic conflict began in Guangdong between the Punti and Hakka peoples which would claim roughly a million lives.
Japan: Ansei great earthquakes series ends with a 1855 Edo earthquake followed by devastating fire.
Malta: Three Gozitan representatives personally petition Pope Pius IX for a separate Roman Catholic diocese for Gozo; the pontiff promises his support.
Russia: Nicholas died. His son, Alexander II, became tsar.
Sweden: Construction of the first railway line in Sweden begins.
USA: The Farmers' High School, later Penn State University, is founded.
